intro: Diplotaxis virgata subsp. tenuirostris, commonly known as narrow-beaked diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. It is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
